meanings.definition: Arousing or exciting interest or curiosity.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious book had a titillative cover that made me want to read it.
meanings.sent2: The movie trailer was so titillative that I couldn't wait to see the film.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map had a titillative clue that led to a surprising discovery.
meanings.sent4: Her titillative smile hinted at a secret she was hiding.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks were so titillative that the audience was captivated.

meanings.definition: Causing a tingling or tickling sensation.
meanings.sent1: The fizzy drink left a titillative feeling on my tongue.
meanings.sent2: The soft feathers had a titillative effect on her skin.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's antics were titillative and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The cool breeze had a titillative touch on her face.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected compliment sent a titillative shiver down her spine.
